title.native: ピーターグリルと賢者の時間
title.romaji: Peter Grill to Kenja no Jikan
title.english: Peter Grill and the Philosopher's Time

description:
Peter Grill is the world’s strongest fighter, but his ascent to the top came with an unexpected consequence: Women around the world, human and monster alike, want to bear his genetically superior children! Since he’s currently engaged to the love of his life, Peter isn’t too keen on his sudden popularity, and it will take every ounce of self-control for Peter to keep his hands to himself and his relationship with his paramour in one piece!

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Netorare
tags.description: Netorare is what happens when the protagonist gets their partner stolen from them by someone else. It is a sexual fetish designed to cause sexual jealousy by way of having the partner indulge in sexual activity with someone other than the protagonist.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Elf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an elf.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Tentacles
tags.description: Features the long appendages most commonly associated with octopuses or squid, often sexually penetrating a character.

tags.name: Large Breasts
tags.description: Features a character with larger-than-average breasts.

node.description:
Born in Tochigi prefecture.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/gokutubusi23)

**Height:** 159cm

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YuiNinomiya0906)

[Profile (TaWaRa)](http://www.ta-wa-ra.com/creator/%e3%83%86%e3%82%b9%e3%83%88) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomoshima_th) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tom_oshima/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom-H@ck) Introduction Tomohiro Oshima, better known by stage name Tom-H@ck, is a Japanese guitarist, producer, composer and arranger. He is also a member of, and a production manager for the groups OxT and MYTH & ROID. Biography His musical interest started when he was 9-years-old, as its when he got to experience playing a musical instrument for the first time in his life. Later at the age of 15, he gained more experience, but this time he got to play a guitar instead, and at the same time he also started to compose music. He started to work as a composer, an arranger and a guitarist for the company Far East Peach, where he worked as a sound creator. As of 2016 he has mainly been active in the joint unit with artist Ooishi Masayoshi, titled OxT (Ooishi x Tom-H@ck), and in the band MYTH & ROID. He's also representative director for TaWaRa Co, LTD, which he established with his own production team from F.M.F Co, LTD. Affiliations - TaWaRa Co, LTD. (2016-) - OxT (2015-) - MYTH & ROID (2015-) - Flyingpan Records (2012-) - F.M.F Corporation (Source: Wikipedia)

__[Yasuda's Profile (TaWaRa)](http://www.ta-wa-ra.com/creator/%e5%ae%89%e7%94%b0%e6%82%a0%e5%9f%bakanadeyuk) | [Twitter (Yasuda)](https://twitter.com/YUK_kanade) | [Utatane's Profile (TaWaRa)](http://www.ta-wa-ra.com/creator/%e3%81%86%e3%81%9f%e3%81%9f%e3%81%ad%e6%ad%8c%e8%8f%9ckanadeyuk) | [Twitter (Utatane)](https://twitter.com/Utatanekana)__ Introduction KanadeYUK is a two-piece collaboration between Yasuda Yuki and Utatane Kana who are both Japanese songwriters and arrangers. They are affiliated with TaWaRa Inc. Members: Yuuki Yasuda（安田悠基） Birthplace: Hofu City, Yamaguchi Prefecture Roles: Lyrics, arrangement and mainly band sounds/digital sounds Kana Utatane（うたたね歌菜） Date of Birth: May 13, 1994 Birthplace: Fukuoka City, Fukuoka Prefecture Roles: Composition, arrangement, mainly strings, piano and orchestration (Source: ja.wikipedia.org)

__[Profile (TaWaRa)](http://www.ta-wa-ra.com/creator/hotaru) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hotar_)__ __hotaru__ is a Japanese lyricist and story planner for the band MYTH & ROID. He is affiliated with TaWaRa Inc.

[Profile (TaWaRa)](http://www.ta-wa-ra.com/creator/%e3%83%86%e3%82%b9%e3%83%88) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomoshima_th) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tom_oshima/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom-H@ck) Introduction Tomohiro Oshima, better known by stage name Tom-H@ck, is a Japanese guitarist, producer, composer and arranger. He is also a member of, and a production manager for the groups OxT and MYTH & ROID. Biography His musical interest started when he was 9-years-old, as its when he got to experience playing a musical instrument for the first time in his life. Later at the age of 15, he gained more experience, but this time he got to play a guitar instead, and at the same time he also started to compose music. He started to work as a composer, an arranger and a guitarist for the company Far East Peach, where he worked as a sound creator. As of 2016 he has mainly been active in the joint unit with artist Ooishi Masayoshi, titled OxT (Ooishi x Tom-H@ck), and in the band MYTH & ROID. He's also representative director for TaWaRa Co, LTD, which he established with his own production team from F.M.F Co, LTD. Affiliations - TaWaRa Co, LTD. (2016-) - OxT (2015-) - MYTH & ROID (2015-) - Flyingpan Records (2012-) - F.M.F Corporation (Source: Wikipedia)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/lantis_ussun)__

__Ryuutarou Usukura__ is a Japanese producer.

__[Website](https://hilcrhyme.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Hilcrhyme2011)__

__Formed:__ 2006, Niigata Prefecture, Japan

__Introduction:__
Hilcrhyme is a Japanese former duo, now solo unit under record label Universal Music Artists (2019–), having previously been under Universal (2009–2017) and Jingumae Records (2018). They were affiliated with the entertainment company Naoplan Co., Ltd (2008–2017), and is currently affiliated with Universal Music Artists (2017–).

The name "Hilcrhyme" originates from a pun on the Japanese pronounciation of hillclimb and rhyme.

__Member:__
- [TOC](https://anilist.co/staff/180186) (トク) – vocalist, rapper and in-charge of lyrics and composition

__Former Member:__
- DJ KATSU (ディージェーカツ) – DJ, in-charge of composition and arrangement.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/TOC_Dress) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tocdress/)__

__TOC__ is a Japanese rapper, vocalist, lyricist and composer. He also has a solo unit named [Hilchryme](https://anilist.co/staff/180185), where he works with various creators.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/TOC_Dress) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tocdress/)__

__TOC__ is a Japanese rapper, vocalist, lyricist and composer. He also has a solo unit named [Hilchryme](https://anilist.co/staff/180185), where he works with various creators.

__[Website](https://br-z.themedia.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/brz_jilty)__

__Birthplace:__ Sendai City, Miyagi Prefecture, Japan

__Tomoya Saitou__, better known as Br'z, is a Japanese music producer, guitarist, composer and arranger. He really likes tofu and claims he wants to eat it everyday.

__[Website](https://br-z.themedia.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/brz_jilty)__

__Birthplace:__ Sendai City, Miyagi Prefecture, Japan

__Tomoya Saitou__, better known as Br'z, is a Japanese music producer, guitarist, composer and arranger. He really likes tofu and claims he wants to eat it everyday.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/runamari)__

__Minoru Hirata__, also known as Shusei, is a Japanese producer, animation planner, lyricist, composer and arranger. He is known to work on various shorter animated projects, usually TV Shorts.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/runamari)__

__Minoru Hirata__, also known as Shusei, is a Japanese producer, animation planner, lyricist, composer and arranger. He is known to work on various shorter animated projects, usually TV Shorts.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/runamari)__

__Minoru Hirata__, also known as Shusei, is a Japanese producer, animation planner, lyricist, composer and arranger. He is known to work on various shorter animated projects, usually TV Shorts.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/AyaE_0421)__

__Birthplace:__ Ishikawa Prefecture, Japan

__Ayae Miyabi__ is a Japanese vocalist and voice actress.
__Miki Fujimoto__ is a Japanese CG artist and character designer.
Also is a writer, producer and director for ADV Films and Robotboy Films.

John Ledford is an entrepreneur and leader in the North American anime industry. In 1992, he founded A.D. Vision (ADV), paving the way for other businesses and the exponential growth anime has had within North America. With ADV's success, Ledford turned his sights to making the imaginative world of anime even more accessible with Anime Network's founding, North America’s first cable TV network dedicated to anime. He later partnered with Kadokawa Publishing and began Newtype USA with translated Japanese content and exclusive U.S. material related to all things anime, manga, and model reviews. This endeavor expanded into ADV Manga, which obtained licensing and publishing rights for hundreds of Japanese manga and Korean manhwa.

In 2008, Ledford founded a new anime-focused company called Sentai Filmworks (Sentai). Since its founding, Sentai provides thousands of hours of content across traditional and digital platforms. Sentai’s dedication to bringing captivating stories, including acclaimed titles such as Grave of the Fireflies, Ninja Scroll, and High School of the Dead to audiences, is ongoing.

Ledford’s most recent success is with the 2017 founding of the streaming service HIDIVE. Since launching, HIDIVE is now available via a web browser, mobile devices, gaming platforms, and more. HIDIVE offers new simulcasts every season, an ever-growing collection of dubs, and exclusive titles. The service features DUBCAST SM editions, early access local-language dubs of simulcasts directly produced by HIDIVE, as early as two weeks after the original Japanese broadcast.

For nearly thirty years now, Ledford continues his goal to further the expansion of anime and the Japanese culture as a whole.
Producer and VP of business and legal affairs with formerly ADV and now Sentai Filmworks.

Handles international coordination for dubs.
